event_context.name: Stockholm 2025 Ecumenical Jubilee
event_context.significance: Modern ecumenical movement foundation, Archbishop SÃ¶derblom Nobel Peace Prize legacy

church-of-sweden.ecclesiology: Episcopal-synodical, democratic governance, national church model
church-of-sweden.soteriology: Lutheran justification by faith, emphasis on grace alone (sola gratia)
church-of-sweden.sacramental_theology: Two sacraments (Baptism, Eucharist), broad inclusivity, episcopal confirmation
church-of-sweden.social_ethics: Progressive activism: climate leadership, LGBTQ+ inclusion, refugee advocacy, peace building
church-of-sweden.ecumenical_theology: Full WCC engagement, Porvoo Communion, ecumenical leadership heritage
church-of-sweden.swedish_context: Separated from state 2000, cultural establishment role, declining but significant membership (~3.3M)

swedish-pentecostal.ecclesiology: Congregational autonomy with cooperative fellowship, democratic local governance
swedish-pentecostal.soteriology: Four-fold Gospel: Jesus as Savior, Sanctifier, Healer, Coming King; personal salvation emphasis
swedish-pentecostal.sacramental_theology: Two ordinances (baptism by immersion, communion); baptism in Holy Spirit with initial evidence
swedish-pentecostal.social_ethics: Holistic gospel combining evangelism with social action, addiction recovery, immigrant integration
swedish-pentecostal.ecumenical_theology: Selective evangelical cooperation, growing openness to broader Christian dialogue
swedish-pentecostal.swedish_context: Immigrant church origins, now fully integrated, strong youth engagement, contemporary worship

roman-catholic.ecclesiology: Papal primacy, episcopal hierarchy, magisterial authority, universal church unity
roman-catholic.soteriology: Grace through faith and works cooperation, sacramental mediation, purgatory doctrine
roman-catholic.sacramental_theology: Seven sacraments, ex opere operato efficacy, eucharistic transubstantiation
roman-catholic.social_ethics: Catholic Social Teaching: preferential option for poor, peace advocacy, creation care (Laudato Si')
roman-catholic.ecumenical_theology: Vatican II ecumenical commitment, bilateral dialogues, unity through visible communion
roman-catholic.swedish_context: Small minority (~150K), immigrant communities, interfaith dialogue leadership

ecumenical-patriarch.ecclesiology: Conciliar authority, episcopal collegiality, autocephalous churches, patriarch as 'first among equals'
ecumenical-patriarch.soteriology: Theosis (deification), synergy of divine grace and human cooperation, mystical union emphasis
ecumenical-patriarch.sacramental_theology: Seven mysteries, real presence in Eucharist, chrismation, married priesthood allowed
ecumenical-patriarch.social_ethics: Creation theology, environmental patriarch, peace advocacy, traditional moral teaching
ecumenical-patriarch.ecumenical_theology: Orthodox theological dialogue, unity through shared apostolic succession and faith
ecumenical-patriarch.swedish_context: Small immigrant communities, Finnish Orthodox Church presence, limited but growing

anglican-communion.ecclesiology: Episcopal structure, via media between Catholic and Protestant, Canterbury primacy of honor
anglican-communion.soteriology: Reformed emphasis on grace, Catholic sacramental life, reason-scripture-tradition balance
anglican-communion.sacramental_theology: Two dominical sacraments primary, five others recognized, broad eucharistic theology
anglican-communion.social_ethics: Anglican social gospel tradition, peace advocacy, environmental stewardship, inclusion debates
anglican-communion.ecumenical_theology: Bridge church identity, Porvoo Agreement with Lutherans, bilateral dialogues
anglican-communion.swedish_context: Minimal presence, primarily expatriate communities, Church of Sweden cooperation

swedish-catholic.ecclesiology: Diocese of Stockholm under papal authority, Cardinal Arborelius leadership
swedish-catholic.soteriology: Universal Catholic teaching adapted to Swedish secular context
swedish-catholic.sacramental_theology: Full Catholic sacramental life, Nordic cultural adaptations in liturgy
swedish-catholic.social_ethics: Catholic Social Teaching emphasis, interfaith dialogue leadership, immigrant pastoral care
swedish-catholic.ecumenical_theology: Vatican II ecumenical commitment, active in Swedish Christian Council
swedish-catholic.swedish_context: Growing through immigration, strong interfaith presence, cultural bridge role

query_templates: What are the main ecumenical opportunities/obstacles for Stockholm 2025?
How do global denominations adapt in Swedish context?
Which theological themes show convergence around 'Time for God's Peace'?
